alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 4:34PM EDT until June 02 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN BERKSHIRE AND SOUTH CENTRAL BENNINGTON COUNTIES... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Adams, Adams, Stamford, Florida, West Summit, North Adams State College Athletic Field, Hairpin Turn, Houghtonville, Briggsville, Noel Field, Whitcomb Summit, Zylonite, Eastern Summit, East Renfrew, Braytonville, Renfrew, Brayton Hill, Soldiers Memorial Field, Hoosac Tunnel and Drury. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
